effects.description:
Enemy spell resistance: -20%
	(enemy armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
No time for idle rats! Move tails and get in formation; you train and condition until Rikcruk says otherwise.
If you wish to expand into new territory, it helps to head-up a voracious, colonising force that breed likeâ€¦ er, oh!

effects.description:
Income from Province Capital/Settlement buildings: +2%
	(all regions factionwide)

Income from Province Capital/Settlement buildings: +4%
	(all regions factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +10%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +30%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: You will obey or you will be slice-killed and fed to the Stormvermin.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 when in foreign territory
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Clan Rictus has survived-thrived in this desolate waste through willpower and Skaven ingenuity.
Slave rats do bidding of Stormvermin, maintain equipment, and make tasty meal for elite Rictus soldiers, yes-yes!

effects.description:
Armour: +4 for Stormvermin units
	(own armies in province)

Melee attack: +2 for Stormvermin units
	(own armies in province)

Leadership: +2 for Stormvermin units
	(own armies in province)

Armour: +8 for Stormvermin units
	(own armies in province)

Melee attack: +4 for Stormvermin units
	(own armies in province)

Leadership: +4 for Stormvermin units
	(own armies in province)

skillTree.localised_description: Move your tails! Rikcruk will be most powerful warlord... I mean, Clan Rictus will be most powerful clan.

effects.description:
On turn start, Lords in this character's region have a chance to gain -1 loyalty
	(own characters in region)

On turn start, Lords in this character's region have a chance to gain -2 loyalty
	(own characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Any cowardly rats smelling of fear musk will be slice-killed, or trampled beneath the boots of my loyal Stormvermin.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer a leadership penalty when the Lord dies. It can also rally after routing more often.

skillTree.localised_description: Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.
As you might expect, the forces of order are repelled by the Skaven and their myriad disgusting, disease-ridden ways.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dwarfs
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Lizardmen
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against High Elves, Lizardmen, Dwarfs and men

skillTree.localised_description: Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Clanrats units

skillTree.localised_description: Having to hide, for an extended period, in a dark, dank recess, in order to entrap and kill your target encourages lateral thinking.

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing exactly where and when to strike is essential when fielding fiendish, potentially battle-winning plague-weapons.

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

skillTree.localised_description: This one has seen the hideous deformities created by Clan Moulder firsthand and now fancies himself a dab hand with a needle and threadâ€¦

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Early years spent in the gutter both prepares the ambitious rat for power and schools him in the dirtier, more cut-throat ways of war.

	(Lord's army)

Speed: +20% for Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for Gutter Runners and Night Runners units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one knows just what to say to 'encourage' the very best work from his underling Warp-smiths and technicians.

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -10% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -15% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere â€“ even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle â€“ spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

items.colour_text: Warpstone powder mixed with steel during the forging process creates a weapon of wicked cutting prowess.

effects.description:
Enemy spell resistance: -20%
	(enemy armies in region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: No time to hesitate! Other clans grow in power-influence, and Rikcruk--I mean, Grand Chieftain Craventail--will not be left to scraps-morsels, but will rule largest clan in all of Skavendom!

effects.description:
Melee defence: +10 for Tretch Craventail
	(own characters in region)
Melee attack: +10 when in foreign territory
